findings.title: CRVStrategySwerve#depositArbCheck() always returns true
findings.description: The logic to choose calculation is written in the opposite way, causing the function to always return true.

findings.title: RewardPool#notifyRewardAmount() does not check if it received reward.
findings.description: The function notifyRewardAmount() in RewardPool contract does not verify receipt of rewards before distribution, potentially leading to high reward rates for some farmers and preventing others from earning rewards.

findings.title: RewardPool#notifyRewardAmount() can decrease rewardRate
findings.description: The notifyRewardAmount function in RewardPool contract can cause a decrease in the reward rate.

findings.title: Vault#setVaultFractionToInvest() can not be set to enable full investment.
findings.description: Because of the second require statement, vault can not invest the full amount of deposits

findings.title: HardRewards#load() can lead to temporary loss of fund when changing token address
findings.description: When HardRewards#load() changes the token address, it does not return the original token, leading to a temporary loss of funds. This issue can be resolved by switching back to the original token, but may cause malfunction if other hardworkers are rewarded between changes.

findings.title: NoMintRewardPool has an Owner which can be misleading against the Governor
findings.description: The NoMintRewardPool contract has an owner which may cause confusion with regards to the Governor.

findings.title: PlayerBook has a Governor role but it is not stored in the Storage contract.
findings.description: PlayerBook has a Governor role but it is not guaranteed to match the Governor role stored in the Storage contract.

findings.title: Misleading Function Name
findings.description: The PlayerBook#hasRefer() function name implies it's a view function but it allocates new pid if _pID_ doesn't exist, making it misleading.
